title: Monitor - RP 16078
description:
Sistema Fiep também é sinônimo de Educação e Capacitação.

Unindo formação empreendedora, professores experientes e unidades distribuídas pelo Paraná, o Sistema Fiep prepara crianças, jovens e adultos para os desafios acadêmicos e profissionais.

Se você deseja contribuir com o nosso propósito, de transformar o Paraná no melhor lugar para a indústria no Brasil, esta vaga pode ser sua!

Qual é a posição?Quais são os desafios e as principais responsabilidades?
  • Conhecer o Projeto Político-Pedagógico e o Regimento Escolar do estabelecimento de ensino.
  • Garantir o cumprimento do Regimento Escolar.
  • Organizar e acompanhar a entrada e saída dos alunos.
  • Orientar a movimentação dos alunos nos diversos ambientes da Unidade, do início ao término das atividades escolares.
  • Zelar pela segurança individual e coletiva, orientando os alunos sobre as normas disciplinares para manter a ordem e prevenir acidentes.
  • Assegurar a disciplina dos alunos nas dependências da Unidade.
  • Zelar pelo cumprimento do horário das aulas.
  • Prestar assistência, quando necessário, ao aluno que adoecer ou sofrer qualquer acidente, comunicando o fato imediatamente à equipe pedagógica.
  • Comunicar imediatamente à Orientação Pedagógica ou equipe pedagógica situações que apresentem riscos à segurança dos alunos e demais fatos que exijam tomada de decisões disciplinares.
  • Encaminhar à equipe pedagógica os alunos que necessitarem de orientação ou atendimento.
  • Monitorar a permanência de alunos fora das atividades pedagógicas e a saída antecipada sem autorização.
  • Organizar, atender e acompanhar os alunos no período de intervalo.
  • Cumprir integralmente seu horário de trabalho e intervalo.
  • Observar a utilização do uniforme, caso seja obrigatório na Unidade.
  • Impedir a permanência de pessoas estranhas na Unidade.
  • Estar atento à movimentação de pessoas suspeitas nas proximidades da Unidade, evitando contato com os alunos.
  • Impedir contatos íntimos e pessoais entre os alunos.
  • Orientar os alunos quanto à proibição de fumar nas dependências da Unidade.
  • Atentar-se a possíveis casos de tráfico e uso de substâncias entorpecentes.
  • Zelar pelo sigilo de informações pessoais de alunos, técnicos de ensino, colaboradores e famílias.
  • Cumprir as disposições do Regimento Escolar dentro da sua esfera de atuação.
  • Garantir que nenhum aluno menor de idade saia da Unidade.
Quais são os principais requisitos?
  • Diferencial: Estar cursando Ensino Superior nas áreas da educação, como Pedagogia, Letras, Psicopedagogia, entre outras correlatas ou estar cursando Curso Técnico na área da educação, como Magistério, Técnico em Educação Infantil, Técnico em Orientação Educacional, ou áreas afins.
  • Diferencial: Possuir experiência na área.
  • Possuir conhecimento em Pacote Office nível básico.
  • Para candidatos internos, atender aos critérios de elegibilidade NG 0077 (4.5.4).

Conhecimentos necessários:

title: Digital Marketing Growth Specialist
description:
Are you a creative, growth-driven marketer eager to make an impact?

At HealGuid , we’re redefining holistic healthcare—making it more accessible, trusted, and patient-centered . As we expand into the global market, we need a standout individual to drive digital marketing, community growth, and business development—someone bold, creative, and ready to build from scratch.

What You’ll Do
  1. Social Media & Content – Plan, create, and publish high-impact content (Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.).

Who you are (Skills & Fit)
  1. Creative + Growth-Oriented – You understand how to engage audiences and drive conversions.
  2. Hands-On & Adaptable – You thrive in a startup , balancing multiple projects and wearing different hats.

title: Engenheiro de aplicações de campo
description:
Olá! A BenQ Brasil é parte integrante da BenQ Corporation - líder mundial em tecnologia e soluções, impulsionada pela visão corporativa de “Bringing Enjoyment ‘N’ Quality to Life” para elevar e enriquecer todos os aspectos da vida que mais importam para as pessoas em seu dia a dia - estilo de vida, negócios, saúde e educação.

Direcionada pela filosofia única de "Because it matters", a BenQ está empenhada em capacitar as pessoas para que vivam melhor, aumentem a eficiência, sintam-se mais saudáveis e melhorarem a aprendizagem através de produtos e soluções orientados para as pessoas. O espírito, como a nossa própria existência para melhorar a experiência da vida em todos os aspectos, subjaz ao desenvolvimento de nossos produtos, modelo de negócios, parcerias e cultura corporativa. É também o que inspira nossos funcionários dedicados e nos direciona para a cidadania global.

Porque é importante (Because it matters), a BenQ continuará a utilizar recursos substanciais e experiência comprovada em design de produto, exibição visual, soluções móveis e tecnologias de convergência de rede com a esperança de encantar o mundo, oferecendo uma ampla gama de produtos e soluções: projetores, monitores, telas interativas de grande formato e iluminação LED.

Agora que você sabe um pouquinho sobre nós, venho aqui dizer que temos uma vaga aberta para o cargo de Field Application Engineer (Engenheiro de Aplicações em Campo), segue abaixo um pouco sobre a vaga :)

Responsabilidades:
  1. Realizar suporte em nível básico/intermediário na infraestrutura, helpdesk e principalmente foco nos produtos para todo o time interno da BenQ Brasil, parceiros e clientes.
  2. Manutenção Preventiva e Corretiva dos produtos.
  3. Capacitação interna e externa dos produtos.
  4. Escalonamento de chamados.
  5. Suporte em campo.
  6. Realização de reuniões com times técnicos e definições de pré-requisitos para projetos junto aos parceiros e clientes.
Requisitos:
  1. Experiência com pré e pós vendas de produtos.
  2. Experiência com rotina diária dentro de escritório.
  3. Disponibilidade para possíveis viagens para treinamentos e suporte.
  4. Cursando ensino superior em cursos voltados à área de tecnologia da informação ou curso técnico.
  5. Experiência com chamados N1 em Helpdesk.
  6. Experiência com chamados N1 em infraestrutura.
  7. Inglês ou espanhol básico.
  8. Experiência com treinamentos.

Habilidades comportamentais desejadas: Excelente comunicação oral e escrita, trabalho em equipe, habilidades interpessoais (soft skills), iniciativa, senso de urgência, dinamismo, planejamento e organização.

Conhece alguém que tem este perfil? Curta e compartilhe!

title: Advogado(a) Júnior ou Pleno - Tributário Indireto
description:
Advogado(a) Júnior ou Pleno - Tributário Indireto

Advogado(a) com forte gosto pela área tributária, particularmente por tributos indiretos, que seja curioso(a) e interessado em inovar, se aprimorar e ajudar o escritório em seu crescimento.

Como nosso escritório é preponderantemente empresarial, procuramos alguém com veia multidisciplinar, que tenha gosto e facilidade de interação com matérias afins, como tecnologia, economia, negócios, comércio exterior e logística para trazer valor a nossos serviços aos clientes.

Stocche Forbes tem sólida atuação em Tributário, auxiliando nossos clientes, grandes multinacionais estrangeiras e brasileiras, em seus negócios dos mais variados setores, a navegar pelos desafios da tributação indireta, a mais complexa do nosso sistema e que está em intensa e constante mudança.

Responsabilidades:

  • Análise de casos complexos juntamente com a equipe e sob supervisão;
  • Auxílio nas consultas diárias dos clientes;
  • Modelagens econômicas dos impactos fiscais sobre as operações;
  • Modelagem econômica sobre impactos da reforma tributária no modelo de negócio das empresas;
  • Elaboração de análise jurídica sobre alterações propostas pela reforma tributária e implementação das alterações nas áreas da empresa;
  • Realização de pesquisas de todas as ordens;
  • Participação em estudos de novidades legislativas ou jurisprudências da área, seja para atendimento a clientes ou para desenvolvimento de teses.

Requisitos:

  • Experiência em tributação indireta;
  • Saber trabalhar em equipe e em um ambiente multidisciplinar, diverso e inclusivo.

Somos um dos principais escritórios de advocacia “full service” do Brasil. Nosso time é formado por profissionais altamente qualificados e inovadores, focados em estabelecer com os clientes uma parceria de longo prazo, baseada na confiança , ética e na excelência de nossos serviços .

A Diversidade é um de nossos valores mais caros, e garantimos aos nossos profissionais o acesso a um ambiente inclusivo, respeitoso e seguro, dando a eles todo o acolhimento e as ferramentas necessárias para que possam se desenvolver plenamente, em uma verdadeira e genuína promoção da equidade.

Nosso Programa de Diversidade & Inclusão, conta, atualmente, com quatro pilares, sendo eles:

  • SF Mulher – Equidade de Gênero
  • Radix – Equidade Étnico Racial
  • Ultra – Pessoas com Deficiência

Seja você quem for, seja você quem quiser ser, aqui toda pessoa é bem-vinda, acolhida e respeitada!

description:
Granado | Phebo abre as portas para você!

Estamos em busca de um Divulgador Médico para fazer parte da nossa equipe. Se você é uma pessoa organizada, dinâmica e comprometida, esta pode ser a oportunidade perfeita para você. Como Divulgador Médico, você será responsável por promover a divulgação de produtos para classe médica, realizando visitas.

Responsabilidades:
  1. Realizar visitação médica para divulgação de Produtos.
  2. Promover os produtos da empresa utilizando as estratégias de marketing.
  3. Gerar relatórios diários de visitação.
  4. Domínio de uso de tablet e materiais promocionais digitais.
  5. Acompanhar o mercado concorrente, suas ações de marketing e lançamentos.
  6. Dominar os conceitos técnicos dos produtos e se reciclar para a efetiva promoção deles.
  7. Estreitar relacionamento com formadores de opinião que possam contribuir para divulgação dos produtos.
  8. Criar painel médico e manter atualizadas as informações cadastrais de seus clientes (médicos).
  9. Realizar visita virtual, caso seja demandado.
  10. Implementar planos de ação diferenciados para determinados produtos, com o objetivo de aumentar a demanda ou neutralizar as ações dos concorrentes, respeitando a legislação vigente.
  11. Trazer feedback e informações do campo para a matriz e a equipe regional.
  12. Organizar mini eventos/ações, caso necessário com o público médico.
  13. Realizar eventos nos consultórios médicos, quando necessário.
  14. Participar de feiras profissionais para divulgar as linhas trabalhadas.
  15. Averiguar e potencializar o merchandising nos consultórios (folhetos na recepção, material de comunicação, onde for possível).
Requisitos:
  1. Graduação completa.
  2. Experiência com divulgação de Produtos na área médica.
  3. Bom networking no mercado com profissionais da área médica.
  4. Ter carteira de motorista e carro próprio.
Benefícios:
  • Vale-Refeição para bater aquele papo legal e descontraído com os seus colegas enquanto degusta as iguarias.
  • Plano de saúde, odontológico e seguro de vida para garantir o seu bem-estar e o da sua família.
  • Descontos exclusivos em produtos Granado e Phebo.
  • Ambiente que estimula a criatividade e ao desenvolvimento, com apoio ao aprimoramento através do Programa de Educação Continuada.
  • Programa de Participação nos Resultados.
Sobre a Granado e Phebo:

Desde o século XIX, a Granado atravessa gerações encantando seus consumidores com produtos de qualidade e com uma pegada sustentável. A Perfumaria Phebo , fundada em 1930, é sinônimo de luxo, excelência olfativa e qualidade. Acreditamos que o clássico não precisa ser antigo e estamos comprometidos com a inovação e a preservação do meio ambiente.

Diariamente, somos convidados a escrever novos capítulos dessa trajetória de sucesso! Vamos juntos!

title: OPERADOR DE ESCAVADEIRA
description:
Job description

Buscamos um (Operador de Escavadeira ) que atuará em atividades (Operar escavadeiras de forma segura e eficiente, realizando atividades de escavação, movimentação e transporte de materiais em obras de construção, mineração ou infraestrutura ).

Na Armac, nos esforçamos diariamente para construir relacionamentos duradouros com nossos colaboradores e parceiros, com base na confiança, respeito mútuo e compromisso compartilhado.

Se você tem orgulho em servir, atitude de dono, coragem para fazer acontecer e tem interesse em fazer parte de um ambiente que tem como valores a segurança em primeiro lugar, que incentiva a simplicidade e a humildade nas ações de seus colaboradores e considera queintegridade, excelência e ética são inegociáveis, o seu lugar é aqui na Armac!

Inscreva-se e venha fazer parte da nossa jornada.



Main responsibilities
  • Operar escavadeiras de acordo com os procedimentos e normas de segurança;
  • Realizar escavação de terrenos para fundações, valas, canais e outros tipos de infraestrutura;
  • Carregar, descarregar e movimentar materiais como terra, areia, pedras e cascalho, utilizando a escavadeira;
  • Realizar o nivelamento e preparação do solo conforme as especificações do projeto;
  • Monitorar e manter o bom funcionamento da escavadeira, realizando inspeções diárias e reportando qualquer problema ou necessidade de manutenção;
  • Cumprir os prazos estabelecidos para a execução de tarefas, garantindo a eficiência no trabalho;
  • Trabalhar em equipe com outros operadores de máquinas e com engenheiros e outros profissionais de construção;
  • Seguir as normas de segurança e utilizar os Equipamentos de Proteção Individual (EPIs) adequados;
  • Reportar e comunicar à liderança qualquer incidente ou risco identificado durante as atividades;
  • Colaborar na organização e limpeza do canteiro de obras, mantendo o local seguro e limpo.


Requirements and skills
  • Curso de capacitação e habilitação para operação de máquinas pesadas, como escavadeira (se necessário conforme legislação local);
  • Experiência comprovada como operador de escavadeira;
  • Conhecimento das normas de segurança e operação de máquinas pesadas;
  • Habilidade para realizar manutenções básicas nas máquinas e identificar problemas operacionais;
  • CNH categoria B.


Additional information

  • Vale Transporte: Mobilidade R$450,00;
  • Plano de Saúde: Unimed;
  • Plano Odontológico: Bradesco;

  • Propor soluções com autonomia, apoiando a tomada de decisão de diferentes níveis de liderança; Articular a relação entre as demandas técnicas e de negócio para as equipes de desenvolvedores, considerando fatores internos e externos;
  • Liderar o processo de consenso para decisões técnicas de alta complexidade nos times de desenvolvedores.

Aqui No Agibank Você Terá Que:

  • Exercer a liderança técnica da equipe, oferecendo suporte e orientação em todas as fases do ciclo de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Propor evoluções tecnológicas nos sistemas em conjunto com o time de arquitetura para organizar e priorizar o backlog do time;
  • Monitorar a execução das boas práticas de desenvolvimento de sistemas;
  • Garantir a mais alta qualidade de software, desde o planejamento até a entrega;
  • Monitorar o desempenho e performance dos sistemas das aplicações;
  • Antecipar-se a oportunidades e problemas, agindo com rapidez e eficácia, desenvolvendo soluções de forma preventiva;
  • Auxiliar na orientação dos desenvolvedores mais novos e contribuir nas tomadas de decisão do projeto;
  • Atuar na integração e interface entre as aplicações de back-end;
  • Atuar no planejamento e levantamento de requisitos e limitações técnicas para melhoria da performance e escalabilidade das aplicações;
  • Orientar tecnicamente as etapas de iniciação, planejamento, execução, controle e encerramento dos projetos, monitorando a qualidade, funcionalidades, progressos e desvios;
  • AWS (S3, Pipelines, EKS, VPC, SG, Kafka, MSK e demais serviços do fluxo de CI/CD);
  • Arquitetura distribuída em Microsserviços e Containers na Cloud (EKS/Docker);
  • APIs em SpringBoot com integrações em Kafka e Rest utilizando FeignClient/webclient com tolerância a falhas (Fallback em Hystrix/resilience4j);
  • DBs Redis, Mongo e Postgre;
  • Documentação no Confluence e Swagger;
  • Boas práticas de desenvolvimento de software (SOLID);
  • Qualidade de Código (TDD, Clean Code) e Code Review;

Alguns benefícios, facilidades e parcerias pra você curtir a jornada com a gente:

· Vale-refeição e/ou alimentação;

· Plano de saúde com isenção em exames preventivos 1 vez ao ano;

· Total Pass, pra atividade física e bem-estar;

· Programa de Participação nos Resultados (PPR) seguindo as regras estabelecidas anualmente;

· Programa de sócios do Agi, o Tô de Dono/a;

· Folga de presente no mês do seu aniversário;

· Pesquisa semanal de clima, a Sem Climão;

· Avaliação de performance;

· Teleatendimento psicológico e médico gratuito, com o Conexão Saúde;

· Licença-maternidade de 6 meses e licença-paternidade de 20 dias;

· Dr. Pet: possibilidade de fazer plano de saúde para o seu pet com até 20% de desconto;

· Fretado de ida e volta para Campinas, Indaiatuba e São Paulo (Barra Funda, Eldorado e Paulista). São lugares reserváveis, com chegada às 8h e saída às 18h.

Conheça nossa cultura

O Agibank é para quem vive em eterna busca de conhecimento e não para mesmo quando tudo e todos jogam contra.

Quem faz parte, sabe que, ao superar desafios, coisas boas acontecem para o cliente, para a empresa e para sua própria carreira. Aqui, a gente se orgulha de reunir uma galera assim: agilizada, gente aberta, corajosa e que busca crescimento.

Prepare-se para sair totalmente da zona de conforto , para escutar feedbacks empáticos, mas radicalmente francos, e para transformar todos os desafios em oportunidade de aprendizado.

No Agibank, a vontade de crescer corre na veia, e quando essa vontade se junta, ela não pede licença. E o ambiente abre passagem para quem transforma caminho em estrada.

Juntos, lutamos por uma experiência bancária que acolhe e encoraja todos os brasileiros.

Se você sentiu seu coração bater forte daí, o Agibank pode ser pra você. Vamos crescer juntos?

A Soluções Usiminas é uma empresa do Grupo Usiminas . Maior valor agregado do aço - é a Usiminas atuando com sinergia em toda a cadeia produtiva do aço: mineração, logística, siderurgia, transformação do aço e bens de capital.

A Soluções Usiminas atua através de uma moderna infraestrutura de processamento de aço. Em cada uma das unidades industriais localizadas estrategicamente em todo país, encontram-se modernos processos que garantem a qualidade dos produtos e a satisfação dos clientes.

Só conseguimos nossos resultados por causa das nossas pessoas, que são o bem mais precioso da Usiminas . Por isso, manter um time de profissionais inovadores e que queiram fazer a diferença com a gente é essencial. Veja abaixo algumas informações sobre a vaga e se inscreva para participar do processo seletivo! Venha fazer parte do time Soluções Usiminas !

Como Técnico de Segurança do Trabalho você vai:

  • Verificar o cumprimento das normas de segurança do trabalho e exigências legais;
  • Apoiar a divulgação dos programas e normas de segurança do trabalho pré-estabelecidos;
  • Participar da identificação básica das condições de ocorrência dos acidentes, elaborando laudos;
  • Realizar a distribuição e monitorar a utilização dos equipamentos de proteção individual e coletiva.
REQUISITOS E QUALIFICAÇÕES

FORMAÇÃO: Curso Técnico em segurança do trabalho.

Quais benefícios irei receber?

  • Plano de saúde;
  • Seguro de vida;
  • Previdência Privada;
  • Participação nos Lucros e Resultados.

Diversidade e Inclusão

A Usiminas está cada dia mais diversa e inclusiva e acredita que todos têm o potencial para serem o que realmente são! Por isso, nossas vagas são abertas para todos e todas que queiram participar do processo, sem distinção, por exemplo, por deficiência, gênero, raça e etnia, geração, orientação sexual, entre outros.

title: Auditor de Suinocultura
description:
Job description

Nascidos e forjados no agro. Somos multiproduto, com um portifólio diverso, versátil e competitivo. Somos multi-elo, provendo solução integral com consultoria especializada, securitizadora e gestora.

Criamos, estruturamos e operacionalizamos modelos de crédito customizados e aderentes ao negócio, melhorando integralmente o resultado da sua operação financeira.

Manejamos e lidamos com o risco no agronegócio de forma sistêmica, entendendo toda a cadeia de valor do crédito, do tomador ao investidor.

Aqui na Ceres nos preocupamos com todo o nosso ecossistema de atuação e acreditamos que podemos transformar o mundo em um lugar melhor através da alta capacidade de originalização e alocação dos recursos.

Entendemos que a experiência do cliente alinhada ao uso de tecnologias e um time de campo com autonomia e engajamento, em um ambiente seguro e adequado são nosso maior patrimônio.

Nossa gente é nosso maior ativo! Por isso, nos preocupamos com o desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional de todos. Incentivamos o aprendizado contínuo e a coragem para tomar riscos pensando no longo prazo.

Se você se identifica, candidate-se e nos conheça um pouco mais!


Main responsibilities
  • Conhecer e acompanhar as rotinas Suinocultura (manejo/engorda/terminação), com todos os procedimentos da operação, da entrada ao embarque (abate);
  • Realizar suas atividades visando o alcance de todas as metas definidas para a sua função;
  • Atender cliente interno e externo com qualidade, eficiência, simpatia, cordialidade e respeito;
  • Participar de 100% dos treinamentos em que for convocado pela organização;
  • Conservar e zelar pelo patrimônio da empresa;
  • Conhecer a visão e a missão da empresa;
  • Cumprir normas regulamentadas da empresa e da sua área de atuação;
  • Zelar pela ética e disciplina na empresa;
  • Utilizar práticas do 5S;
  • Executar outras tarefas correlatas às acima descritas, a critério de seu superior imediato.

Requirements and skills

Formação acadêmica:

  • Formado em Medicina Veterinária ou Zootecnia, com experiência em suinocultura;

Experiência:

  • Experiência com Operação de Suinocultura;
  • Conhecimento de agronegócio será um diferencial;

Vivências esperadas:

  • Experiência sólida na área de Suinocultura;
  • Habilidade Pacote Office / Excel Intermediário;
  • Programas de gestão de suinocultura será um diferencial;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em um ambiente multifuncional e colaborativo;
  • Categoria B.

Additional information

Necessário residir em Patos de Minas - MG

title: Senior Client Services Manager
description:
We are a global digital agency comprised of strategists, creatives, media experts, data scientists, and engineers driven by one common purpose — accelerate business growth through marketing and digital transformation. Named a top 3% Google Premier Partner and recognized by Inc. 5000 and Adweek’s 75 Fastest Growing Companies, we’re constantly looking for “A” players to join our team.

The rapid growth is attributed to our strongest asset — our people. Our teams are highly collaborative and work closely with each client to set clear goals and objectives so that we can deliver exceptional results. Mindgruve is a place where every opinion is valued. Not only will you be empowered to contribute ideas, but you will also play a key role in the execution and driving success for brands across a variety of industries. Sound fun? Perfect — you’ll fit right in.

Responsible for managing and developing assigned accounts in a consultative and strategic manner. As well as ensuring long-term relationships and identifying the main needs of each client, providing guidance and a correct approach to the internal operation, with the purpose of guaranteeing the business achievements of all of our clients.

What You'll Do Here:
  • Work together with account managers to detect the client's particular needs and requirements, in order to achieve optimal account development.
  • Develop and manage timelines, define and track tasks, dependencies, priorities, and milestones.
  • Monitor budgets, establish project plans and processes to avoid and/or resolve scope creep, budget overages, or efficiency issues.
  • Facilitate communication between internal teams and clients whenever necessary.
  • Lead the Account Manager Team, providing periodic feedback and guidance.
  • Maintain excellent long-term customer relationships and develop strategies to build loyalty and retention.
  • Supervise and monitor the correct execution of processes and presentation of results to the client, ensuring that the necessary detailed information is provided, thus achieving the objectives established in the agreement between the company and the client.
  • Understand the commercial objectives of our clients by deep diving and investigating their market, trends, and target.
  • Guide directly supervised teams by establishing performance goals, providing periodic and detailed feedback on labor performance, and coordinating meetings to achieve professional development objectives.
  • Manage administrative processes.
  • Foster and promote an empathetic and respectful culture within the Operations team and guarantee effective interaction between the different areas of Macarta, permeating this dynamic regionally in the projects and requirements that demand it.
  • Tell the story behind customer KPIs, confidently interpreting trends and making recommendations based on Amazon digital marketing analytics.
  • Request monthly billing from customers.
We Need a Person With:
  • Completed or in progress of a Marketing degree or related fields.
  • Fluent English: proficiency to discuss, write, and carry out presentations.
  • Analytical skills capable of identifying and anticipating opportunities to increase customer profitability.
  • Intermediate Excel skills to handle functions like Vlookup and pivot tables.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and capability to adapt to changing campaign requirements and client needs.
  • Previous experience in account management or sales.
  • 5+ years of experience as a people manager leading teams.
  • Demonstrated experience managing teams in search and/or performance teams.
  • Experience with E-Commerce, Digital Marketing, Retail Media, and/or Performance Media is a plus.
  • Extremely organized with keen attention to detail.
  • Capable of self-managing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to lead, motivate, and develop teams, establishing a collaborative, high-performance work environment.
  • Capable of working in a dynamic environment and handling multiple priorities.
What We Consider as a Plus:
  • Spanish language skills.
  • Advanced Excel/Sheets skills.
  • Experience with project management programs.
  • Experience with Marketplace campaigns.
  • Certifications in Google Ads and Shopping.

title: Senior Systems Engineer, Genesys Cloud (Remote from Brazil)
description:
Senior Systems Engineer, Genesys Cloud (Remote from Brazil)

Thursday, February 13, 2025

Questrade Financial Group (QFG), through its companies - Questrade, Inc., Questrade Wealth Management Inc., Community Trust Company, ThinkInsure, Zolo, and Flexiti, provides securities and foreign currency investment, professionally managed investment portfolios, mortgages, insurance, real estate services, financial services and more. Questrade uses cutting-edge technologies to develop innovative products that give customers better, more affordable ways to take control of their money.

We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. At QFG, you will be constantly moving forward, bringing the future of fintech into existence. You will be a part of a collaborative team that cares deeply about our mission and each other. Your team members will help you conquer challenges, push boundaries and discover what you are truly capable of.

This is a place where you can explore, discover and learn with continuous growth. As a diverse and inclusive place to work, with a hybrid working environment you can unleash your creativity and curiosity with no limits. If you share the same sense of infinite possibility, come shape your future at QFG.

What’s in it for you as an employee of QFG?

  • Health & wellbeing resources and programs
  • Paid vacation, personal, and sick days for work-life balance
  • Competitive compensation and benefits packages
  • Career growth and development opportunities
  • Opportunities to contribute to community causes
  • Work with diverse team members in an inclusive and collaborative environment.

The purpose of the Senior Systems Engineer, Genesys Cloud, is to practice and apply software development and engineering discipline merged with systems administrator discipline and concepts with technology solutions related to Servicing Systems Engineering (SSE) domain of products, systems and services with a focus on contact centre tools and technology built on and around Genesys Cloud platform. This role will play a proactive role in improving our customer journeys and agent experience and delivering significant business value through Omni Channel/ CCaaS.

We’re looking for our next Senior Systems Engineer. Could It Be You?

This role is responsible for connecting the Technology team and the lines of business. They translate the requirements from the business teams and have an understanding of its execution from a technology perspective. This role builds relationships and liaises with various stakeholders, internal and external, understanding the impact of any changes to products from a business and technical capability. The Principal Business Systems Analyst might act as a Product Owner for Agile teams. Also as a Principal role it must support other BSAs, improve and implement new guidelines on Business systems analyses related work.

This role will primarily provide hands-on involvement and understanding of the ins & outs of Corporate Telephony Solutions/Contact Center; help with designing (e.g. tech design document, tech requirements, roadmaps) for business driven enhancements & requirements; and support the Operations Engineering team on various small to medium project as a Business Systems Analyst (BSA).

So are YOU our next Senior Systems Engineer ? You are if you…

  1. Lead and maintain product portfolio of customer contact centres throughout Questrade Financial Group entities.
  2. Consult multiple business and operations stakeholders to elicit, define, analyze and document requirements for products and services supported by the OE team.
  3. Prepare detailed requirements for internal and external stakeholders on feature upgrades, defect resolution or other relevant queries to enhance the current system functionalities.
  4. Responsible to prepare and support various artifacts necessary to comply with IT Governance, Risk Management, Compliance, Legal etc. requirements for projects and products with regulatory oversight.
  5. Work closely with Technical Product Managers, Business Product Managers, Agile Product Owners, Business Unit leads and stakeholders on product vision, assess business impact and propose technology solutions that is best suitable.
  6. Support the technical product roadmap for the core systems, technical decisions on vendor solutions or enhancements with data and evidence for ongoing business.
  7. Prioritize features across other projects and priorities at QTG with a focus on IT vision and aligned with annual QFG objectives.
  8. Lead, facilitate and coordinate technical discussions, elicitation meetings, requirement gathering discussions with stakeholders, product, vendors to achieve complete requirements from start to end of projects or product increments.
  9. Understand and assess business and technology impact on core or supporting systems when other projects trigger changes in the organization.
  10. Continuously collaborate with domain experts, business and technology stakeholders, product owners, sponsors, both internal and external customers (end-users) as required for various products through all stages of product development and release.
  11. Identify process and solution improvements or system functionality gaps on the core systems and work with peers to identify and deploy appropriate solutions.
  12. Ensure proposed solutions reflects the 4Es; easy to buy, easy to sell, easy to understand, and easy to get service.
  13. Think like the customers and business owners to understand and summarize business problems, and synthesize the requirements into complete user stories for backlog.
  14. Prepare periodic status updates, reports or dashboards to inform leadership, management, and stakeholders on the progress of projects or upcoming releases.
  15. Visualize the bigger picture, assess the impact/risk of having or not having a solution to the problem and related systems/products that may be impacted by the solution.
  16. Collaborate frequently with technology groups like QTG Leads and Directors, RTE, user experience (UX), development, solution architect, information security, digital marketing, QA and application support teams to solve various business and customer problems.
  17. Create and maintain knowledge and thinking relationship for new and existing products, processes, systems/solutions and services.
  18. Experienced to create and maintain a variety of artefacts including user stories, epics and product backlog items, business case, proposal, requirements (BRD, SRD), use cases, conceptual data models, workflow diagrams, solution intents, presentations for senior management, executives or business stakeholders, mock-ups, prototypes, test scenarios, traceability matrix to validate requirements.
  19. Create and maintain OE artefact templates and continuously adjust them based on project needs; may be required to conduct peer reviews of user stories or requirements.
  20. Stay focused through distractions, stakeholder demands, stress, deadlines, multiple projects and shifting priorities by ensuring you are aligned with vision and mission of QFG.
  21. Comfortably shift between agile or traditional software delivery methodologies to develop new/existing products, their upgrades, improve processes and other initiatives as needed.
  22. Play the role of Product Owner or Scrum Master or Agile Coach when situations call for it to support OE agile teams.
  23. Able to work with ambiguous requirements and strives to extract meaningful and complete requirements to establish quality features/product increments.

Minimum Qualifications:

  1. University degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent combination of post-secondary education and practical experience in a relevant field will be considered.
  2. 6-8 years working as a business systems analyst or business analyst or technical analyst role within the financial services industry.
  3. 5+ years in large scale technology implementations across an organization.
  4. Strong knowledge of Genesys Cloud call center solutions or related products.
  5. Lead product development in investments, banking and lending industry.
  6. Proficient in workflow design and documentation skills – decision diamonds, decision trees, decision tables, state machines.
  7. Have excellent interpersonal, verbal and written skills and the ability to interact with multiple levels of stakeholders.
  8. Excellent time-management and organizational abilities that facilitate structured teamwork.
  9. Ability to follow directions from leadership, work under minimal supervision with some ambiguity and present various technical solutions for teams to consider.
  10. Ability to adapt and change based on new business requirements and environment.
  11. Strong critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills.
  12. Ability to articulate technical solutions to non-technical audiences and vice versa.

TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE

  • Good understanding of working with REST APIs, SOAP APIs.
  • Good understanding of SLA, SLO and SLI to assist teams and business on technical requirements.
  • Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages.
  • Experience with digital technologies including online, mobile, and equivalent digital platforms.
  • Ability to cultivate strong working relationships with a large extended project team and influence those around you.
  • Familiar with cloud computing services, tools and processes, particularly GCP.
  • Experience in managing product development, backlog planning and prioritization.

CALL CENTRE SYSTEMS RELATED

  1. Minimum 3-5 years experience in gathering operational usage insights for contact centre technologies to promote operational efficiencies.
  2. Expert knowledge of Genesys Cloud CX and Engage Cloud solutions.
  3. Salesforce experience and certifications.
  4. Working knowledge of application programming, database and system design.
  5. At least 3+ years of information technology and BSA experience in the financial/customer service systems/solutions development area (especially in mortgages, lending and investments).
  6. Knowledge of SDLC, agile delivery, development, coding, testing (QA) methodologies.
  7. Knowledge of writing/understanding/interpreting API documentation.
  8. Certification on business analysis/project management (i.e., CBAP, PMP etc.).

description:
Job description

Buscamos um Mecânico de Empilhadeiras que atuará em atividades de manutenção corretiva e preventiva.

Na Armac, nos esforçamos diariamente para construir relacionamentos duradouros com nossos colaboradores e parceiros, com base na confiança, respeito mútuo e compromisso compartilhado.

Se você tem orgulho em servir, atitude de dono, coragem para fazer acontecer e tem interesse em fazer parte de um ambiente que tem como valores a segurança em primeiro lugar, que incentiva a simplicidade e a humildade nas ações de seus colaboradores e considera que integridade, excelência e ética são inegociáveis, o seu lugar é aqui na Armac!

Inscreva-se e venha fazer parte da nossa jornada.


Main responsibilities
  • Realizar diagnóstico e manutenção preventiva e corretiva em empilhadeiras;

  • Seguir normas de segurança e procedimentos operacionais;
  • Colaborar com a equipe para resolver problemas técnicos complexos;
  • Participar de treinamentos e atualizações sobre novas tecnologias e métodos de manutenção.

  • Possuir habilitação na categoria B;

title: AI/ML Agent Engineer
description:
About Eightx
We provide Fractional CFO, Controllership, and Bookkeeping services for fast-growing eCommerce Brands and Agencies from Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom with one goal in mind:
To help eCommerce business owners scale their businesses with more cash and less stress.
This requires a broad range of skills, including financial modeling, risk management, understanding of US/Canadian GAAP, financing, audit, investor relations, and more.
We are small but growing fast, which means you will get the chance to specialize and grow into future roles such as AI Director or Automation Architect.
Lastly, as you might expect of a finance company, we work hard when we need to, but we don't work hard just for the sake of it. We don't miss our kids' concerts, we work out during the day, and we usually sign off early on Fridays.

About The Position
You will lead the implementation of AI and automation solutions for our business and our clients. You will work on internal and client projects including:

  • Creating AI agents
  • Replacing manual workflows with AI and automation
  • Integrating disparate systems to create sources of intelligence (eg. Meta, Quickbooks, Google, etc)

Requirements

What you will do

  • AI Agent Creation: You will lead the creation of agents to replace manual tasks, increase team output, etc.
  • AI Development and Implementation: Export and process data from emails, Slack, and meeting transcripts; Train AI models to provide accurate and contextually relevant responses.
  • Workflow Analysis and Integration: Replace manual workflows with automation and AI; Create integrations between platforms like QuickBooks, Facebook, Instagram, and other APIs.
  • Automation and Reporting: Develop automation systems to streamline processes and reduce manual effort; Design and implement reporting systems with AI-driven insights.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with the CEO, finance team, and other departments to ensure seamless integration and adoption of AI tools.

Specific Tool Experience

  • Experience with n8n, pipedream, zapier or other similar systems.
  • Broad LLM experience.

What You Must Have

  • Proven experience developing AI/ML solutions and workflow automation.
  • Strong programming skills, preferably in Python.
  • Familiarity with AI frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Experience with APIs and integrating diverse systems.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • The ability to work independently and collaboratively.

Your Experience And Education

  • Experience building and training AI agents for real-world applications.
  • Proven track record in process automation and data analysis.

How To Apply
Submit your resume and a short video in your application. Answer these questions:

  • Why are you interested in this position?
  • What do you know about our company?
  • What is your ideal work environment?
  • What are your strengths?
  • Where do you see yourself in five years?

For your video:

  • Make it maximum three minutes.
Applications without a video will be ignored.

The Application Process

  • Application with video
  • Short workstyle assessment (15mins)
  • 15 minute Interview
  • PAID Case Study
  • Final Interview
  • Offer

Benefits

  • Full-time, competitive salary (commensurate with experience and education)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote work
  • Generous vacation and time-off policies

Seniority level: Entry level

Employment type: Full-time

Job function: Engineering and Information Technology

Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting

title: Analista de inteligência de mercado
description:
Na Hyundai Motor Brasil, buscamos profissionais comprometidos e apaixonados pela excelência.

Como Analista de Inteligência de Mercado , você será responsável pelo acompanhamento das clínicas de produto junto ao instituto, o desenvolvimento de pesquisas de satisfação de novos clientes da Hyundai online e o acompanhamento e criação de relatórios de performance comercial da Hyundai e do mercado.

As principais atividades serão:

  • Criar e analisar relatórios e dashboards da performance comercial da Hyundai e do mercado automotivo no Brasil e na América Latina;
  • Prover análises de mercado com insights que possam direcionar a estratégia da empresa;
  • Conduzir pesquisas de mercado: NCBS, clínicas de produtos, pesquisas ad-hoc, first buyers, etc.;
  • Realizar previsões de mercado (volume de vendas) e analisar tendências;
  • Administrar as bases de dados de emplacamentos;
  • Preparar e apresentar reports para a gerência e diretoria.

Se interessou? Os requisitos para concorrer à vaga são:

  • Superior em Administração, Marketing, Economia, Engenharia;
  • Conhecimento em Software de apresentação de dados (Tableau / Power BI);
  • Excel avançado;

Local de trabalho: São Paulo - SP (modelo híbrido).

A Hyundai Motor Company, sediada na Coreia do Sul, está passando por uma transição significativa de ser fabricante de automóveis para se tornar provedora de soluções de mobilidade inteligente. Para acelerar a concretização dessa mudança, estamos investindo em tecnologias inovadoras que transformarão a maneira como as pessoas interagem com suas soluções de mobilidade e melhorarão sua qualidade de vida.

Comprometida com a sustentabilidade, a Hyundai iniciou medidas para liderar uma era de mobilidade mais sustentável eletrificando sua linha de produtos e expandindo seus negócios de hidrogênio para veículos comerciais e dispositivos de utilidade. Além da mobilidade, confiaremos na economia circular para moldar um futuro mais sustentável que beneficiará não apenas a Hyundai como empresa, mas a sociedade como um todo.

A Hyundai Motor Brasil começou suas operações em 2012, introduzindo o modelo único HB20 no mercado local, projetado e desenvolvido especificamente para o país. Atualmente, a empresa atua como sede regional para a América Central e do Sul, exportando do Brasil para Uruguai, Paraguai, Colômbia e México. Com perspectivas promissoras para a região, a Hyundai Motor Brasil, também conhecida como Hyundai Motor Central & South América, está introduzindo tecnologia de ponta de modelos premiados mundialmente, como o IONIQ 5, e avançando para implementar soluções movidas a hidrogênio junto com ações sociais e ambientais para contribuir com as sociedades onde opera na região. Se você aspira fazer parte de uma equipe líder em inovação na indústria automotiva, venha se juntar a nós na Hyundai e faça parte desta jornada rumo ao sucesso.

Movimento audacioso, energia positiva e trabalho de qualidade; este é o nosso DNA Hyundai; este foi o poder que nos permitiu ser líder global na indústria automotiva e será o poder para criar um novo mundo. Estamos em busca de talentos que escreverão uma nova página de nossa história com o DNA Hyundai.

Venha crescer conosco!!!

title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
description:
Who We Are...

AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.

What We Are Looking For...

AvantStay, a fast-growing, venture-funded company in the booming short-term rental industry, is seeking a Senior Salesforce Administrator. We want someone with strong experience customizing and automating Salesforce solutions, along with a history of system maintenance, reporting, and providing excellent customer support to internal teams. In this role you will be the primary person responsible for the design, implementation, and management of our Salesforce environment.

What you'll do...

  1. System Administration & Configuration
    • Manage user accounts, profiles, roles, permissions, and security settings
    • Maintain system health by troubleshooting issues, monitoring system performance, and managing data integrity
    • Customize Salesforce objects, fields, workflows, page layouts, record types, and validation rules to align with business requirements
  2. Process Automation & Optimization
    • Collaborate on key projects to determine business alignment, needs, and system requirements, focusing on Sales Cloud
    • Develop and maintain automation processes using Flow, Process Builder, and other Salesforce automation tools
    • Continuously evaluate and improve workflows, approval processes, and data management strategies
  3. Reporting & Data Management
    • Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and analytics to support decision-making across departments
    • Ensure data quality and consistency through best practices in data cleansing, deduplication, and governance
  4. User Support
    • Provide end-user training to maximize adoption and efficient use of Salesforce
    • Serve as the primary point of contact for troubleshooting user issues and implementing best practices
  5. Integration & System Enhancements
    • Collaborate with Engineering and IT to integrate Salesforce data and workflows into our proprietary software systems
    • Stay updated on Salesforce releases and new features, recommending and implementing enhancements

Requirements

  • 3+ years of Salesforce administrator experience with Sales Cloud
  • Familiarity with SOQL, Apex, and Lightning components
  • Additional Salesforce certifications (Advanced Administrator, Platform App Builder, etc.) are a major plus
  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical problems
  • Ability to work independently and efficiently
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Benefits

  • $20k-$45k depending on location and experience
  • Flexible workplace - work from anywhere outside the US
  • This role will require approximately 40 hours of work per week on a 5-days on, 2-days off schedule. Primary hours are Monday through Friday during US business hours, with possibility of weekend shifts depending on availability and business needs
Seniority level

Entry level

Employment type

Full-time

Job function

Business Development

Industries

IT Services and IT Consulting

title: Policy & Advocacy Manager
description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

To drive Lilly's vision of becoming a strategic partner to the healthcare system by shaping public policies that foster innovation and enhance access to care, the Manager, Public Policy and Government Affairs will own the development and execution of strategic public policy initiatives aligned with the company’s long-term goals. Key areas of focus include preparing the system for innovation in areas such as obesity and Alzheimer’s, driving regulatory frameworks that enable a proper ecosystem for innovation (e.g., clinical trials and regulatory timelines), enhancing corporate reputation, and strengthening strategic partnerships by building coalitions and alliances that increase our influence in the healthcare ecosystem.

This role requires a proactive, strategic thinker with a hands-on approach to execution, capable of building strong relationships with government officials, industry associations, and key stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of the healthcare landscape and regulatory frameworks and have the ability to navigate complex political environments. The Manager will play a crucial role in shaping policies related to healthcare, drug regulations, pricing, and patient access while managing the company’s public image and communications to maintain transparency and foster positive relationships. The successful candidate will combine a deep understanding of the public policy landscape with the ability to deliver measurable results that advance Lilly’s strategic objectives. Flexibility, adaptability, and a strong commitment to collaboration are essential for success in this position.

This role is based in São Paulo, with an expectation of frequent travel (30%) to meet and engage with stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Shape and Execute Strategic Advocacy and Public Policy Initiatives: Own the development, implementation, and measurement of advocacy strategies to influence policy and legislative changes that foster innovation, access to medicines, healthcare system improvements, drug pricing, and intellectual property in line with Lilly’s global and regional priorities.
  • Create Stakeholder Engagement Materials: Develop key messages and materials for stakeholder engagement to effectively communicate policy priorities and positions.
  • Drive Strong Stakeholder Management: Establish and maintain high-impact relationships with government officials, policymakers, patient groups, industry associations, healthcare professionals, NGOs, and other key stakeholders to deliver advocacy strategies that create an environment conducive to innovation and access.
  • Manage projects and sponsorships with key Advocacy groups: Run all the processes with patient groups – assuring that the partnerships are in line with Lilly’s goals and benefit patients.
  • Foster External Coalitions: Build and lead coalitions with industry associations, advocacy groups, and other stakeholders to amplify Lilly’s voice in shaping public policy.
  • Monitor and Analyze Policy Landscape: Proactively monitor, analyze, and communicate legislative and regulatory developments to identify emerging healthcare policy trends, risks, and opportunities in areas such as regulatory, pricing, and intellectual property protection. Deliver actionable recommendations and measurable outcomes that align with business priorities.
  • Champion Internal Alignment: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Market Access, Medical Affairs, Regulatory Affairs, Corporate Communications, R&D and others, to ensure alignment and integration of public policy strategies across the organization.
  • Represent the Company Externally: Represent Lilly in public forums and industry discussions, advocating for policies that support innovation and patient access.
  • Manage Crisis and Policy Response: Lead the company’s response to emerging policy crises and regulatory challenges, ensuring proactive and transparent engagement with stakeholders.
  • Deliver Measurable Outcomes: Define and track KPIs to measure the success of advocacy strategies and public policy initiatives, ensuring accountability for delivering impactful results.
  • Enhance Corporate Reputation: Position Lilly as a trusted leader in public health and innovation by driving initiatives that align corporate values with external policy objectives.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy, Health Sciences, Business Administration, Political Science, Public Policy, Law, Economics, or related fields (required ).
  • Master’s or higher in Public Policy, Public Administration, or Health Economics (preferred ).
  • At least 7 years of experience in government affairs, advocacy, public policy, or healthcare management.
  • Experience in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry is preferred .
  • Deep knowledge of healthcare policies and regulatory frameworks in Brazil , with experience engaging key government agencies, parliamentary fronts, and executive branches at local, state, and federal levels. Strong relationship-building skills with policymakers, government officials, and key industry stakeholders.
  • Proven ability to influence policy decisions in complex legislative and regulatory settings.
  • Proven ability to drive and lead strategic initiatives with measurable outcomes , ensuring alignment with business goals. Skilled at navigating cross-functional environments and leading teams to deliver results through clear planning, execution, and tracking of KPIs.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills , with the ability to engage both internal and external stakeholders at the highest levels. A strong executive presence that inspires confidence and conveys passion for Eli Lilly's mission and portfolio.
  • Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset, capable of translating complex policy issues into actionable strategies that drive tangible outcomes for the business and broader healthcare system.
  • Career progression : Demonstrated growth and increasing responsibility over time, with a clear track record of leadership in complex, fast-moving environments.

title: CT Technologist II
description:
Night Shift, Monday and Tuesday nights 11pm-730am. Includes holiday rotation.

Lehigh Valley Health Network (LVHN) is home to nearly 23,000 colleagues who make up our talented, vibrant and diverse workforce.

Join our team and experience firsthand what it's like to be part of a health care organization that's nationally recognized, forward-thinking and offers plenty of opportunity to do great work.

Imagine a career at one of the nation's most advanced health networks.


Be part of an exceptional health care experience. Join the inspired, passionate team at Lehigh Valley Health Network, a nationally recognized, forward-thinking organization offering plenty of opportunity to do great work.


LVHN has been ranked among the "Best Hospitals" by U.S. News & World Report for 23 consecutive years. We're a Magnet(tm) Hospital, having been honored five times with the American Nurses Credentialing Center's prestigious distinction for nursing excellence and quality patient outcomes in our Lehigh Valley region. Finally, Lehigh Valley Hospital - Cedar Crest, Lehigh Valley Hospital - Muhlenberg, Lehigh Valley Hospital- Hazleton, and Lehigh Valley Hospital - Pocono each received an 'A' grade on the Hospital Safety Grade from The Leapfrog Group in 2020, the highest grade in patient safety. These recognitions highlight LVHN's commitment to teamwork, compassion, and technology with an unrelenting focus on delivering the best health care possible every day.


Whether you're considering your next career move or your first, you should consider Lehigh Valley Health Network.


Summary

Performs CT scans of designated anatomy using professional judgment while imaging with regard to technical quality according to physician specifications. Provides courteous and professional delivery of CT technical exams and procedures while adhering to radiation safety precautions. Supports patient questions and concerns regarding exam procedures and process, while maintaining appropriate confidentiality regarding PHI and HIPAA related information. On-call as required by the department. Works in a hospital facility that offers full hospital services. Provides direct patient care to high acuity patients encompassing emergency, inpatient and outpatient classes supporting up to and including trauma and ICU.

Job Duties

  • Performs all types of imaging procedures and operates all equipment safely and properly including scanners, injectors, and monitors.
  • Reviews all images of all exams, repeating images as necessary for best possible result.
  • Communicates with the patient by addressing the patient by name, introducing self to the patient, explaining the exam in lay terms and keeping the patient informed of exam progress.
  • Prepares patient images to PACS for interpretation by a radiologist and administers contrast media per protocol.
  • Completes technical notes, verifies images, and sends exams to PACS promptly.
  • Notifies physician of any adverse reaction to contrast media or change in patient's condition.
  • Reviews patient chart/script prior to initiating exam to verify pertinent information.
  • Prepares patients for CT procedures by accurately assessing patient’s needs, medical history, and provides patient education.
  • Operates computed tomography scanner for data acquisition, reconstruction of images, documentation of images, and performs quality control measures for the purpose of ensuring optimal quality images.
  • Attends department meetings or other mandatory meetings with a positive attitude.
  • Practices accurate and timely completion of scheduled and unscheduled work to maximize productivity.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Technical School Diploma Graduate of accredited Radiography program or equivalent or
  • CNMT, RT(CT) Certified
  • Less than 1 year experience as a Radiologic Technologist
  • Ability to provide proper patient care essential to radiologic procedures.
  • Knowledge and skills to perform scans on patients of all ages, adapting to various protocols.
  • Proficient use of the advanced software for CT scanning and post procedure processing applications.
  • Strong aptitude for CT technology.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, positive attitude, and upbeat demeanor.
  • American Heart Association Basic Life Support - State of Pennsylvania within 30 Days
  • RT - Registered Technologist Radiology - State of Pennsylvania Upon Hire or
  • CNMT - Certified Nuclear Med Tech NMTCB - State of Pennsylvania Upon Hire
  • CT - Computed Tomography ARRT - State of Pennsylvania within 1 Year

Preferred Qualifications
  • Associate’s Degree Graduate of Health Science program
  • Knowledge and skills to perform venipuncture.

Physical Demands

Lift and carry 40-50 lbs. Examples: Push/pull patients on bed, stretcher (requires 29 lbs. push force), lateral transfers up to 50 lbs. of the patient's weight. Frequent to continuous standing/walking. Patient transporters can walk 8-10 miles per shift. *Patient care providers may be required to perform activities specific to their role including kneeling, bending, squatting and performing CPR.

Job Description Disclaimer: This position description provides the major duties/responsibilities, requirements and working conditions for the position. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current position, however management reserves the right to revise or change as necessary to meet organizational needs. Other responsibilities may be assigned when circumstances require.


Lehigh Valley Health Network is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with, and where applicable, in addition to federal, state and local employment regulations, Lehigh Valley Health Network will provide employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or other such protected classes as may be defined by law. All personnel actions and programs will adhere to this policy. Personnel actions and programs include, but are not limited to recruitment, selection, hiring, transfers, promotions, terminations, compensation, benefits, educational programs and/or social activities.

title: Product Owner - Work from home
description:
Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

A remote team never felt so close Join our LATAM team and stay connected while working remotely. We value our team members and candidates interested in our vacancies. Enjoy fun activities like coffee breaks, tech talks, and games with our developers and management teams during your stay with us.

Who needs micromanagement? For us, communication is key, so we focus on working autonomously, with honesty, and respecting diversity. Micromanagement is not part of our corporate values.

Work-life Balance Your well-being is our priority with our People Care team, available from day one to offer support and help with anything from needing someone to talk to, requesting time off or a holiday, or using any of our offered benefits.

Additionally, our Accounts Management team ensures a smooth and effective stay with our clients, fostering a harmonious relationship with both the client and the project.

Here you'll get:

  1. USD Salary compensation.
  2. 100% remote work, but if you feel like connecting with people you can visit co-working spaces all over LATAM allowing you to expand your professional network.
  3. Paid time off according to your country’s law without affecting your monthly salary to ensure that you have plenty of time to rest and recharge.
  4. Your country’s national holidays allow you to celebrate important events and traditions with your loved ones.
  5. Sick or medical leave when needed so that you can take a day off to take care of your health, and have well-being without worrying about work.
  6. Refundable annual credit for you to spend on your favorite perks.
  7. Team-building activities such as coffee breaks, tech talks, and after-work gatherings with your Nearsure colleagues, to feel close to our community.
  8. A day off during your birthday week to enjoy with your family and friends, ensuring that you have a chance to make memories on your special day.

About the project:

As a Product Owner , you will work as part of an agile software development team and will be responsible for writing detailed specifications, tracking implementation, and following up with stakeholders and developers. This position requires excellent organization and strong domain knowledge.

You will be able to:

  1. Work with stakeholders and others to define vision.
  2. Maintain product roadmap in Monday and other documents.
  3. Write and maintain product requirements by using the product roadmap.
  4. Create requirement documents that can be validated with stakeholders and used as the basis for stories.
  5. Write detailed stories for developers to execute.
  6. Manage the product backlog by deciding the priority of the stories and assigning to the developers.
  7. Work with QA Developer and other testers to validate the product and test cases.
  8. Use domain knowledge to review and guide testing.
  9. Communicate effectively, respectfully, and confidentially (when appropriate) with internal and external customers.

What will help you succeed in this role:

  1. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  2. 5+ Years of experience working using Process Information Management System.
  3. 5+ Years of experience working as Product Manager/Owner.
  4. 5+ Years of experience delivering product.
  5. 5+ Years of experience prioritizing complex roadmaps and backlogs focused on business outcomes.
  6. 3+ Years of experience managing Monday, Jira, Click up, or another management tool.
  7. Advanced English Level is required for this role as you will work with US clients. Effective communication in English is essential to deliver the best solutions to our clients and expand your horizons.

Here's what you can expect from our hiring process:

  1. We'd love to discuss your experience in an interview with our recruiters.
  2. If all goes well, we'll arrange a technical interview with our top developers to evaluate your skills.
  3. If you advance to the next stage, you'll have a chance to meet our client and potentially become a part of our amazing team!

Would you like to work alongside top Latin American talent?

Work remotely from Latin America for US clients with Nearsure, a staff augmentation company that values people and culture. Gain cross-cultural expertise and improve your English skills with daily communication in English.

We're excited to have you on board and can't wait to learn more about you.

O profissional será responsável por desenvolver funcionalidades avançadas, otimizar código e banco de dados, além de implementar boas práticas de segurança e performance.

Responsabilidades:

  3. Criar e otimizar consultas avançadas em MySQL, analisando desempenho e ajustando queries quando necessário;
  4. Desenvolver funcionalidades no frontend com JavaScript Vanilla, utilizando AJAX para comunicação com APIs;
  5. Criar e manter integrações REST e SOAP, tanto no consumo quanto no envio de dados;

  7. Atuar com AWS (SQS, Lambda, API Gateway) para escalabilidade e performance;
  8. Utilizar Bitbucket e Git seguindo um fluxo de trabalho estruturado (Git Flow);
  9. Configurar e gerenciar ambientes Linux, utilizando comandos básicos no terminal;
  10. Aplicar conceitos de Docker e conteinerização para facilitar o deploy e gerenciamento de ambientes.
Habilidades Técnicas:
  1. Experiência sólida como Desenvolvedor PHP Full Stack;
  2. Conhecimento avançado em PHP 5.6 e 7.4, com capacidade de construir um MVC sem frameworks;
  3. Experiência com Laravel (Queue, Job, ORM Eloquent);
  4. Conhecimento avançado em MySQL, incluindo consultas otimizadas e análise de performance;
  5. Experiência em JavaScript Vanilla, incluindo manipulação de DOM e chamadas AJAX para APIs;
  6. Conhecimento em integrações REST e SOAP;
  7. Experiência com AWS (SQS, Lambda, API Gateway);
  8. Familiaridade com Git e Bitbucket, seguindo boas práticas de versionamento;
  9. Conhecimento básico em Linux, incluindo comandos via terminal;
  10. Experiência com Docker e conteinerização;
  11. Conhecimento em caches (Redis, Memcached, sessão, cookies, etc.).
Habilidades Comportamentais:
  1. Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autônoma e resolver problemas complexos;
  2. Boa comunicação e colaboração com a equipe;
  3. Perfil analítico e voltado para performance e qualidade do código;
  4. Organização e habilidade para cumprir prazos e documentar processos;
  5. Disposição para aprendizado contínuo e adaptação a novas tecnologias.
Diferenciais:
  1. Experiência com outras versões mais recentes do PHP (8.x);
  2. Conhecimento em ferramentas de mensageria como RabbitMQ;
  3. Experiência com outros bancos de dados (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB);
  4. Familiaridade com arquitetura de microserviços;
  5. Certificações AWS ou PHP.

title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Santos
description:
Job ID: 2895913 | Amazon EU SARL (UK Branch)

Are you interested in a job that combines technical skills with marketing savvy? If so, the Product Marketing Manager position may be a great fit for you.

Amazon has spent years building one of the world’s most efficient and optimized supply chains. Santos is an organization based within the supply chain arm of Amazon and owns two products-- Buy with Prime (BWP) and Multi-channel fulfilment (MCF). Santos’s vision is to make off-Amazon fulfilment as simple and easy as on Amazon fulfilment, while delivering more selection and a better shopping experience to customers with prime-like services on non-Amazon sites.

Santos is present in 10 countries; our vision is ambitious - to fulfil orders for every customer in the world, regardless of where the transaction occurs. With the expanding business, Santos is seeking a talented Product Marketing Manager for driving product adoption and retention in the three prioritized international markets. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, industry-leading business.

Product marketing plays a critical role in bringing the Voice of the Customer to the forefront and developing an aligned product value proposition for the market. The ideal candidate is a strong influencer and will own bridging alignment across internal and external stakeholders. The incumbent will own key market growth KPI’s (acquisition, engagement and unit targets), the product positioning narrative in the market and shape the future direction of customer lifecycle management in expansion marketplaces. The ideal candidate has experience leveraging data to gain insights and solve problems, experience with content strategy, and technical channel marketing skills. The candidate needs to be deeply analytical, detail-oriented, and obsessive over constantly improving the campaigns via experimentation. In this role, you will collaborate with multiple stakeholders across Santos marketing and with external stakeholders to identify and drive innovative solutions. Our team values attention to detail, ownership, and the ability to work autonomously, while having fun while accomplishing our goals together.

Key job responsibilities

  1. Technical understanding: Develop a thorough understanding of salesforce email tools, owned and operated channels like seller central, Selldot etc.
  2. Gather insights via testing: Define the experiment roadmap. Identify key segments that we can acquire from/engage with. Run A/B tests across themes, use cases, templates, personalization formats, creatives, time of the day to gather learnings which will help us optimize omni-channel campaigns across the funnel i.e., traffic, consideration, conversion and continued engagement.
  3. BAU campaign governance: Build campaigns in partnership with channel marketing managers to ensure the right product positioning is being communicated to the right segments.
  4. Campaign optimisation: Optimize all campaigns against key metrics including open rates, CTR, product adoption, and unit lift.
  5. Reporting and channel planning: Analyse and report on channel performance metrics campaigns on a weekly and monthly basis. Optimize marketing mix based on these insights. Basis channel trends, own projections and goal revisions.
  6. Operations: Marketing experience including managing email campaigns, social media campaigns, owned and operated channel campaigns (building, testing, and sending).
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
- Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs
- Experience leading go-to-market for consumer software or hardware product launches
- Experience in marketing or marketing research
- Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
- Experience presenting metrics and progress to goal to senior leadership

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience using SQL or other analytical tools for conducting data analysis
- Experience with customer segmentation, profiling, and targeting
- MBA

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice ( to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Customer Success Operations Specialist, Email Security
description:
Customer Success Operations Specialist, Email Security

Customer Success | Full Time | Job Id: 22340 Now Available Entry Level

Why Join Us?

As the world’s leading vendor of Cyber Security, facing the most sophisticated threats and attacks, we’ve assembled a global team of the most driven, creative, and innovative people. At Check Point, our employees are redefining the security landscape by meeting our customers’ real-time needs and providing our cutting-edge technologies and services to an ever-growing customer base.

Check Point Software Technologies has been honored by Time Magazine as one of the World’s Best Companies for 2024. We've also earned a spot on the Forbes list of the World’s Best Places to Work for five consecutive years (2020-2024) and recognized as one of the World’s Top Female-Friendly Companies. If you're passionate about making the world a safer place and want to be part of an award-winning company culture, we invite you to join us.

Key Responsibilities

Data Cleaning & Management:

  • Perform hands-on data cleaning and validation to ensure all entries are accurate, consistent, and complete.
  • Investigate and resolve data discrepancies by reaching out to Sales representatives and managers to clarify or gather missing information.
  • Maintain the integrity and usability of key datasets to support business operations and decision-making.

Reporting & Analysis:

  • Generate detailed reports on customer adoption, sentiment, advocacy, and business outcomes (e.g., forecasts, renewals, expansions, and churn) using cleaned and validated data.
  • Partner with the Analyst team to support broader data analysis initiatives.

Process Support & Optimization:

  • Execute lifecycle processes and policies, focusing on hands-on execution rather than strategy definition.
  • Identify opportunities to streamline data handling and automate repetitive tasks where possible.

Content & Documentation:

  • Maintain and update playbooks and documentation to guide consistent and efficient data management practices.
  • Work closely with Customer Success and Sales teams to address data-related issues promptly.
  • Escalate unresolved data challenges or operational gaps to leadership, ensuring timely resolution.
What You'll Bring:
  • A detail-oriented, hands-on approach to managing and cleaning data entries.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to proactively address data inconsistencies.
  • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to work effectively across teams and resolve issues.
  • Technical expertise to handle data cleaning and operational tasks efficiently.
Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience in Customer Success Ops, Revenue Ops, Sales Ops, and/or Business Ops in a fast-growing B2B SaaS environment.
  • Strong hands-on experience with data management, specifically cleaning and correcting data entries to ensure accuracy and usability.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with Sales and Customer Success Managers and representatives to gather missing or inconsistent data and resolve issues.
  • Familiarity with modern tools, including support platforms, customer success platforms, and NPS tools.

Must be eligible to work in country of residence without sponsorship from an employer now or in the future.

EOE M/F/Veterans/Disabled

Sobre a Rede D’Or:

Fundada em 1977, a Rede D’Or é a maior rede privada de assistência médica integrada do país, com 46 anos de existência. Está presente em 13 estados e no Distrito Federal, operando 74 hospitais, dos quais 71 são próprios e 3 sob gestão, somando quase 12 mil leitos. A Rede D’Or detém uma das maiores redes diagnósticas do Brasil e uma extensa operação de banco de sangue.

Realizar manutenções preventivas e corretivas em elevadores, escadas rolantes e outros equipamentos de transporte vertical, garantindo seu perfeito funcionamento e segurança.

Diagnosticar falhas e defeitos nos sistemas eletromecânicos dos elevadores, utilizando ferramentas e equipamentos adequados para a detecção de problemas.

Atender prontamente às solicitações de emergência para reparos, garantindo a rápida resolução de problemas e a minimização de impactos aos usuários.

Colaborar com a equipe de manutenção e outros departamentos para assegurar a eficiência e a qualidade dos serviços prestados.

Participar de treinamentos e capacitações periódicas para aprimorar conhecimentos técnicos e habilidades práticas na manutenção de elevadores.
